basics.name: Chima Jude Iheaturu, Ph.D. (cand.)
basics.label: Remote Sensing & Geodata Scientist
basics.summary: Ph.D. researcher specializing in remote sensing, UAV-based forest mapping, LiDAR analysis, and spatio-temporal modelling of forest dynamics. Experienced in machine learning for land-cover mapping and dedicated to advancing ecological knowledge through open science, co-production, and interdisciplinary approaches.

location.address: Institute of Geography, University of Bern

work.name: Wildlife Conservation Society (WCS)
work.summary: Managed spatial data for conservation areas in Nigeria, performing advanced forest change detection and stakeholder reporting.
highlights: Developed semi-automated pipelines for deforestation monitoring.
Integrated socio-economic data with spatial analytics for conservation planning.

work.name: ENVI Geospatial Ltd.
work.summary: Led UAV operations and GIS analysis for environmental and engineering mapping projects across Nigeria.
highlights: Introduced drone LiDAR capabilities for 3D forestry mapping.
Mentored interns and junior analysts in GIS, photogrammetry, and Python scripting.

awards.title: Best M.Sc. Project Award
awards.summary: Recognized for outstanding thesis using low-cost photogrammetry to document GNSS sites.

awards.title: Hydrographic Society Student Award
awards.summary: Outstanding MSc performance in geospatial studies.

awards.title: Governor’s Prize – Best Graduating Student
awards.summary: Best student in Surveying and the Faculty of Environmental Science.

publications.name: An integrated object-based sampling approach for validating non-contiguous forest cover maps
publications.publisher: International Journal of Applied Earth Observation
publications.summary: Proposes object-based stratification for validation in fragmented tropical landscapes.

publications.name: Integrating UAV LiDAR and multispectral data to assess forest disturbance
publications.summary: Multi-sensor fusion approach for mapping disturbance in West African forests.

projects.name: SUSTAINFORESTS Project
projects.summary: Transdisciplinary research on tropical forest persistence using satellite data, UAV-LiDAR, and local knowledge integration.
highlights: Co-designed methods for integrating narratives and spatial data
Mapped forest patch dynamics across West Africa
